page.title: 16DAIRY FARMING
page.content: Dairy farming is carried on at Walsgrove Farm and Old Yates Farm. There are 160 cows at Walsgrove Farm and 80 cows at Old Yates Farm. Work for the day begins at around 6 a.m. when the cows are brought in to be milked.The milking parlour can take 16 cows at a time with 8 on each side. Milking can take up to three hours, with cows to be washed prior to milking, and equipment and milking parlour to be cleaned afterwards. The milk is stored in a refrigerated tank and collected daily by a tanker from The Milk Marketing Board. The farmer is contracted to supply a fixed quota,1,221,000 litres per year which he cannot exceed.An E.E.C. cut of 10% in quota in 1984 caused many problems for milk producers. These were to some extent alleviated by the dry summer lessening milk production.
